ratings.comment: Antonio was an amazing professor, his lecture style involves doing a lot of problems in class which I found very helpful. He was so sweet and even offered for students to come to his Thanksgiving dinner if they were in town for the holiday. He cares a lot about his students and wants them to succeed even though it it a very class material-wise.
He taught statics very well, and was my only lecturer who I actually enjoyed attending. He made a very tough subject as easy as it possibly could be, while not dumbing anything down

Statics is tough in itself so I wouldn't take it out on him. PLEASE do ALL of your homework & all of the readings not doing them cost me an A in the class also do PRePs & this class will be so much easier. Hernandez really cared & tried to connect with his students as much as he could & nothing he assigned felt unreasonable. Take him if you can!!

Professor Hernandez did a great job teaching a difficult class. He understood that it wasn't easy, and seemed to genuinely care and wish the best for his students. He explained the concepts well in lecture and was willing to answer questions. The exams were hard but fair.

He is a phenomenal professor who wants success for all his students. His course is very challenging but he is there every step along the way to help you through it. Biggest issue with the course is your grade is pretty much just exam based and those can be pretty challenging but stick with it!

His lecture are straight to the point. He reviews what you read for 10ish minutes and does 2 tough problems in class. His exams are fair, if you put enough work in you'll get the results. Don't listen to the negativity about him since he does his best. 

 Please get to know him during office hours as he truly does care about helping you succeed.

This class is extremely fast paced and difficult however he cares deeply about his students. Hernandez changed the way he set up discussion based on student feedback after the first exam. Go to office hours and the tables, Hernandez answers questions so well and really wants to help people succeed. HW takes time but is extremely helpful for exams.

Antonio is 100% an amazing professor for this class. The class is very hard but he is great. Sometimes he is in a bad mood and can be snappy when you go up to talk to him but other times hes super understanding

Statics is tough on its own. PLEASE don't take Calc 2 at the same time thinking you can handle two heavy courses at the same time.(Hence the B) For HW, START EARLY so you can do a problem or two every day. Overall, Antonio cares and is a decent professor and it's not his fault there's a lot of material to cover with less time so he has to rush.

Professor Hernandez taught the material well for how challenging the class was. He's monotone and often went very fast in order to get through all the examples but he would always ask if anybody had questions before moving on. Most of the confusion is from the difficulty of the course. My class got him a card at the end of the year to thank him.

Very confusing lectures where he went too quickly over too many problems and topics where I didn't really understand what was going on. Highly recommend taking the Preps class because it was very helpful.

Prof. Hernandez's lectures were replete with clear explanations and practice problems. Although he sometimes goes quickly over the material he also gives students opportunities to ask questions before continuing from one step to another. Also, a lot of opportunities for practice are provided which is definitely necessary for a class like this.

Hernandez is a great teacher for what is ultimately a very difficult class. If you are worried about your grade sign up for the PREPS course or get Chegg (like literally every other engineering student, BFFR).
Hard to follow, the lectures did not help me at all. The only reason I understood the course was due to the preps courses.
Doesn't give feedback on any questions that we got wrong since that would never be helpful, and just doesn't organize the class well.
Pay attention in lecture and do Preps

Lectures were hard to follow and mostly spent on practice problems. The slides are identical to the textbook, with no further explanation. His handwriting isn't clear and solutions aren't available after class. I once asked for help with a problem from the homework and left feeling humiliated for not understanding the material.
Statics is a tough course no matter the teacher. Professor Hernandez just wasn't a really good professor and was kinda boring.

Honestly he's probably one of the best engineering professors I've had. The class itself is a lot of work but if you put in the time it's actually pretty easy. Hernandez was always willing to help and tried to make jokes in lectures so it would be more fun. Overall a great prof.

I actually really liked Hernandez. I have learned more in his lectures than most other teachers I've had in my life. He can go fast at times but if you're paying attention you'll be fine. Tests are fair and reflect crucial problems done in lecture. I think Hernandez gets a bad rep because of how hard the class is and not how bad he is.
Y'all are too harsh on my boy Hernandez. He is a very caring and seems to genuinely care about you. Cut the man some slack. Just because yall don't understand Statics is not his problem.

crazy how the class is statics but he's moving through the lectures at the speed of light. does not give enough time to even copy down what he's writing, much less to actually write it and understand it. the weekly homework is way harder than the midterms and is borderline impossible. at least there is a lot of extra credit on midterms.
The content is difficult but the grading is generous. Professor Hernandez's lectures are hard to follow and he often writes ineligible scribbles while teaching.

Hernandez's class is heavy. He assigns homework that is incredibly time consuming. Only the first 10 minutes of lecture are useful. The rest of the time he does example problems that are hard to follow. He also makes the exams exceptionally harder than the practice materials.

He seems like he genuinely cares about his students' learning which definitely counts for something but I found his lectures entirely unhelpful and by the middle of the semester I stopped going entirely. In lecture he goes super fast and only does practice problems, almost never going over the actual content. I signed up for PREPs which helped.

Hernandez frequently made things due on the weekend that took 5+ hours to complete. His lectures were uninformative and largely unhelpful. Few times was I able to complete a lecture following his work because the pace he moved at was too fast to grasp any of the concepts he was teaching.
Professor was nice but contents are harsh for those who don’t have much physics background.

The exams never cover what is taught in lecture yet they constitute 75% of the overall grade. You are better off skipping lectures and just doing practice probles out of the textbook instead. Furthermore, the pretests offered before exams give you a false sense of security whereas the real exam is nothing like the practice exams.
